member.name: T:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession
member.summary: Direct connection between client and service host with messages encoded and decoded from JSON. For use in debugging issues that might be the result of JSON encoding issues and to collect samples for documentation.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession.Traces
member.summary: Trace Dictionary for this session

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession.#ctor(Goedel.Protocol.JPCProvider,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a remote session without authentication. This call is typically used when beginning an interaction that will lead to the authentication credential being established.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession.#ctor(Goedel.Protocol.JPCProvider,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a remote session with authentication under the specified credential.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession.Post(Goedel.Protocol.StreamBuffer)
member.summary: Post a request and retrieve the response.
member.param: StreamBuffer object containing JSON encoded request.
member.returns: StreamBuffer object containing JSON encoded response.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.DebugLocalSession.Post(System.String,Goedel.Protocol.JSONObject)
member.summary: Post a request and retrieve the response.

member.name: T:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Debugging extensions for PROTOGEN Web Services

member.name: T:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary
member.summary: The trace dictionary class is used for capturing a set of protocol messages for use in documentation. The functions supported include capture of the message objects and presenting them in full or with various levels of redaction.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.HostName
member.summary: The Service Host Name

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.URI
member.summary: The HTTP Web Service URI

member.name: F:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Traces
member.summary: The tract dictionary, maps labels to traces.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Level
member.summary: Set the level of detail for trace messages

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Current
member.summary: The current trace point.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The host name for the example

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Label(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Start a new named trace point. This allows an example generator to assign labels to each test 'label1' and retrieve the 2nd message of trace 'label1' when describing that particular function.
member.param: Console command that caused the trace.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Find the trace point with the specified value

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Request(Goedel.Protocol.JSONObject)
member.summary: Create a trace entry for a request message

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary.Response(System.String,Goedel.Protocol.JSONObject)
member.summary: Create a trace entry for a response message

member.name: T:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint
member.summary: Capture a related set of traces.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint.Command
member.summary: The console command issued to cause the result.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint.Messages
member.summary: The text of the message

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint.Level
member.summary: Current level of trace detail

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint.TraceDictionary
member.summary: The current Trace Dictionary

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint.#ctor(Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for a trace point.
member.param: Locator tag within the trace dictionary

member.name: T:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage
member.summary: Represents a single trace message

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.Payload
member.summary: The text of the message payload

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.Time
member.summary: The time the message was sent

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.IsRequest
member.summary: If true message was a request, otherwise is a response.

member.name: P:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.Status
member.summary: The HTTP result

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.#ctor(Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TracePoint,Goedel.Protocol.JSONObject,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The date and time of the request
If true, this was a request message (sent by the initiator of the conversation. Otherwise it is a response.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.StringHTTP(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wrap minimal HTTP headers round a request
member.param: If true, redact the payload to omit long sections of base64 encoded text.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.StringJSON(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Serialize an individual payload
member.param: If true, Base64 blobs are limited to two start lines and a last line.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.String(System.Int32)
member.summary: Serialize a message at the specified level of detail
member.param: level of detail. 0=full message, 2= HTTP Payload including authentication envelope, 4 = Just the JSON payload. Adding 1 causes the JSON payload to be abbreviated so that Base64 blobs are limited to a start line and a last line.

member.name: M:Goedel.Protocol.Debug.TraceMessage.String
member.summary: Serialize a message at the current default level of detail
